requirements.title: Commitment to Full Scope Coverage
requirements.description: The Service Provider shall explicitly confirm its ability and commitment to deliver the full scope of support activities.

requirements.title: Documentation Management
requirements.description: The Service Provider shall maintain a centralized and continuously updated knowledge base.

requirements.title: Service Coverage Periods
requirements.description: The Service Provider shall be able to ensure support coverage during the required periods.

requirements.title: Supported Languages
requirements.description: Support services shall be provided in both French and English.

requirements.title: Service Model
requirements.description: The Service Provider shall describe in detail its operating model.

requirements.title: Flexibility of the Model
requirements.description: The Service Provider shall demonstrate the ability to dynamically adjust its support capacity.

requirements.title: Governance Structure
requirements.description: Clear governance structure and reporting lines.

requirements.exigence:
The Service Provider shall ensure workforce stability and the preservation of operational knowledge throughout the delivery of support services.

To maintain service quality, business continuity, and consistent user experience, the Service Provider will detail:
             •   The turnover rate for Level 1 support resources within the proposed delivery hubs.
             •   The staffing composition (sub-contractors, freelance, employees).
             •   The process in place to ensure onboarding and knowledge transfer in the event of resource changes.
             •   The retention strategy and means used to ensure continuity and minimize turnover and knowledge loss.

While Accor acknowledges that some turnover is inevitable, the Service Provider is expected to favor a delivery model that promotes resource stability and ensures continuity, particularly for roles requiring close alignment with Accor’s processes and user community.

The Service Provider must provide a detailed description of its account management and oversight structure, clearly identifying the roles responsible for overall service supervision, relationship management, and performance monitoring.
This must include, at a minimum:
             •   The Account Manager and Service Delivery Manager,
             •   Their respective scopes and responsibilities,
             •   Their positioning within the organization and reporting lines,
             •   The mechanisms put in place to ensure effective governance, communication, and issue escalation with Accor.

The Service Provider must formally confirm adherence to the minimum governance structure outlined above. 

This includes full participation in the required committees, delivery of agreed reporting, and implementation of escalation and communication processes as described.

The Service Provider will describe the different committees planned, specifying the participants, frequency, and deliverables with a RACI matrix.

The Service Provider shall define and implement a structured reporting approach to monitor the performance of Level 1 and Level 1.5 support activities. 

This includes producing and sharing regular reports aligned with SLA and KPI requirements (please refer to corresponding sections), as well as ad hoc reports when needed, as listed previously and in accordance with reporting expectations mentioned. 

The Service Provider shall also propose improvements to automate and optimize reporting processes. Examples of dashboards  must be included in the proposal.

The Service Provider must agree to use Accor’s accounts and tooling as the primary operational environment for support services.
             •   The Service Provider is required to operate directly within the tools provided by Accor,
             •   At a minimum, if direct usage is not feasible, the Service Provider must interface with Accor’s ServiceNow ITSM platform, and any other specified tools required for 
                  day-to-day support operations,
             •   The Service Provider must ensure that all interactions (tickets, documentation, communication, reporting) are traceable and accessible within the Accor 
                   environment

The Service Provider shall implement a proactive continuous improvement approach throughout the contract duration. 
This includes, at minimum:
             •   Regular analysis of performance indicators, incident root causes, and user feedback
             •   Implementation of action plans regarding recurrent incidents
             •   Identification and correction of process inefficiencies.

The Service Provider shall remain up to date with relevant technological evolutions, industry best practices, and service enhancements that could improve the quality, maintainability, or cost-efficiency of support services delivered to Accor. 

The Service Provider must demonstrate his expertise in automation and artificial intelligence (AI) tools applicable to service operations, including the use of generative AI to improve ticket handling, user experience, and support efficiency.
During the contract duration, the Service Provider shall:
             •   Identify and propose automation initiatives aimed at reducing the volume of low-value or repetitive tasks within the support scope.
             •   Ensure that such initiatives generate measurable benefits in responsiveness, service quality, and/or cost-effectiveness.

In response to the RFP, the Service Provider must:
             •   Describe in its proposal concrete use cases where AI and automation were successfully applied in similar contexts.
             •   Share feedback and return on experience (REX) from those use cases, including demonstrated value.
             •   Provide its AI roadmap regarding Application management services improvement.

The Service Level Agreements Appendix (Appendix 3) summarizes all contractual SLAs. These SLAs represent the minimum expected service levels.

The Contractor must indicate their acceptance or rejection of each SLA requested by Accor within the Service Level Agreements Appendix (Appendix 3), provide comments to justify their position, and may propose their own standard SLAs as part of their response in the appendix.

The Service Level indicators expected Accor may evolve during the Contract execution, with the possibility for either the Service Provider or Accor to propose improvements to the Service Levels.

However, such evolutions shall only result in enhanced service levels. The SLA levels defined in this RFP constitute a minimum baseline, and no degradation or reduction in service levels will be accepted.

A penalty system will be applied in case of SLA breaches to trigger corrective actions and ensure contractual performance. Distinct penalty models apply for incidents and service requests, as described previously. Penalties are summarized in the Service Level Agreements Appendix (Appendix 3).

The Service Provider shall detail in its response the processes and tools used to monitor SLA compliance and provide monthly performance reports.

The Service Provider shall propose a structured transition methodology to ensure a smooth and secure handover. This approach must cover all key steps expected by Accor: Assessment, Knowledge Transfer, Shadowing, Reverse Shadowing, Handover, and Sign-off. 

The overall transition duration is expected to be 3 months.

The approach should include indicative timelines, required resources, and risk mitigation actions.
A detailed Transition Plan will be validated by Accor and will serve as the execution and monitoring framework for this phase. An initial version of this plan may be included in the Service Provider’s response to the RFP. The awarded Service Provider will have to submit a detailed Transition Plan within 15 business days following the contract award.

The Service Provider must also provide details of the costs associated with each transition phase. These costs must cover all phases necessary to ensure a seamless handover of the support services.

The Service Provider must proactively manage risks to minimize disruptions during the transition phase. Therefore, the Service Provider must implement a comprehensive risk management approach throughout the transition phase to minimize operational disruptions. 
This includes, at minimum:
             •   Risk analysis and Mitigation
             •   Contingency planning
             •   Ongoing monitoring and reporting 
             
The approach shall ensure proactive identification and management of risks to support a smooth and controlled transition.

The Contractor shall detail the reversibility approach and associated activities in the proposal, including the pricing of the service. 

The activities listed in the section below are presented as the minimum expected scope.

The Contractor commits to a reversibility period of up to six (6) months. This duration represents the maximum time allocated for the reversibility, and may be adjusted based on actual needs.

The pricing model to be implemented must enable:
             •   Cost Optimization and Predictability
             •   Quality-driven Performance
             •   Scalability and Flexibility

The Service Provider must propose a flexible and tailored pricing model, aligned with Accor’s specific needs, such as adjusting to workloads peaks, and the strategic objectives defined just above. The model should provide a transparent cost breakdown, detailing components such as human resources, support tools, training, knowledge base maintenance, and service management overhead.

Furthermore, the model shall be subject to review and potential adjustment at the end of the first year of service, to ensure its continued alignment with observed activity levels, performance outcomes, and value expectations as defined in the economic model.

Pricing must account for the multi-regional nature of Accor operations and be presented in Euros (excl. VAT).

Outside of any modification to the scope of Services, the Services themselves, or the Service Levels, the conditions for service delivery depend on two main factors:
             •   The expertise of the Service Provider,
             •   The state of the technologies implemented.

Regarding the first point, the development by the Service Provider of its expertise (technical level of personnel, mastery of Accor’s specific environment, improvement of the Service Provider’s internal methods and tools, industrialization, automation) is a contractual obligation. Accor will benefit from this in terms of service quality (e.g., reduction of backlog, reduction of resolution time, etc.). The Service Provider will benefit from productivity gains thus achieved in terms of financial results (reduction of FTEs, elimination of tickets, etc.).

Over the contract duration, these gains shall be periodically assessed and reflected in the pricing model through cost reductions, even in the absence of changes to the service scope or levels.

Regarding the second point, Accor and the Service Provider, within the framework of the committees:
             •   Will analyze the effects on service delivery conditions of the implementation of innovation and automation projects,
             •   Will agree on the cost consequences of the identified improvements to the services.

Over the contract duration, the Service Provider shall document and present the effects of such improvements. A mutual agreement shall be reached on the financial translation of these benefits, to ensure fair and transparent cost evolution over the contract term.
